The cord is a unit of measure of dry volume used to measure firewood and 
pulpwood in the United States and Canada. A cord is the amount of wood that, 
when "racked and well stowed" (arranged so pieces are aligned, parallel, 
touching and compact), occupies a volume of 128 cubic feet (3.62 m3). ... per
